lead_paragraph: Mr. Finicum, a de facto spokesman for the group that took over a wildlife refuge, was killed when the authorities arrested his fellow protesters.

byline.contributor: Julie Turkewitz reported from John Day, and Jack Healy from Denver.
byline.original: By JULIE TURKEWITZ and JACK HEALY

snippet: Mr. Finicum, a de facto spokesman for the group that took over a wildlife refuge, was killed when the authorities arrested his fellow protesters.

headline.main: LaVoy Finicum: ‘I Would Rather Die Than Be Caged’
headline.print_headline: Protester Who Was Killed Was Group’s Defiant Voice

abstract: LaVoy Finicum, protester shot and killed during standoff between police and occupiers of Malheur National Wildlife Refuge in Oregon, was frequent spokesperson for protesters and one of most recognized faces among them; Finicum's death has further raised his profile among supporters of occupation.
